sustainable energy.Description: Solar power is a form of sustainable energy that harnesses the power of the sun to generate electricity.
Wind power is a form of sustainable energy that converts the kinetic energy of wind into electricity.
Hydropower is a form of sustainable energy that uses the force of moving water to generate electricity.
Geothermal energy is a form of sustainable energy that utilizes heat from the Earth's core to generate electricity.
Biomass energy is a form of sustainable energy that derives power from organic materials such as plants and waste.
Tidal power is a form of sustainable energy that harnesses the energy of tides to generate electricity.
Nuclear power is a form of low-carbon energy that generates electricity through nuclear reactions.
Energy efficiency is a sustainable practice that aims to reduce energy consumption and waste.
Smart grid is an advanced energy infrastructure that incorporates sustainable energy sources for efficient power distribution.
Electric vehicles utilize sustainable energy sources, such as electricity, to power their engines.

Solar power.Description: Solar power utilizes photovoltaic cells to convert sunlight into electricity.
Solar power uses solar panels to capture sunlight and convert it into usable energy.
Solar power requires an inverter to convert the direct current (DC) electricity generated by solar panels into alternating current (AC) electricity.
Solar power can store excess electricity in battery storage systems for later use when sunlight is not available.
Solar power can generate electricity using solar thermal power plants that concentrate sunlight to produce heat and drive a turbine.
Solar power is a major contributor to the production of renewable energy, reducing reliance on fossil fuels.
Solar power can be integrated into the electrical grid to supply electricity to homes and businesses.
Solar power systems can benefit from net metering policies, allowing excess electricity to be fed back into the grid and credited to the owner.
Solar power generation depends on the availability and intensity of solar irradiance, which is the amount of solar energy received per unit area.
Solar power can be generated on a large scale through solar farms, which consist of multiple solar panels or solar thermal power plants.

Wind power.Description: Wind power utilizes wind turbines to generate electricity.
Wind power is generated by wind farms, which consist of multiple wind turbines.
Wind power is a form of renewable energy that harnesses the power of wind.
Wind power generation depends on the speed of the wind.
Wind power generation is influenced by the direction of the wind.
Wind power projects require wind resource assessment to determine the viability of the location.
Wind power is measured in terms of its capacity to generate electricity.
Wind power involves the process of converting wind energy into electrical power.
Wind power is implemented through the construction and operation of wind power plants.
Wind power is part of the renewable energy industry, specifically the wind power industry.

Hydropower.Description: Hydropower harnesses the power of flowing water to generate electricity.
Hydropower plants are built with dams to control the flow of water and create a reservoir.
Hydropower plants use turbines to convert the energy of flowing water into mechanical energy.
Hydropower plants generate electricity from the mechanical energy of flowing water.
Hydropower is a clean and renewable source of energy.
Hydropower plants create reservoirs by storing water behind dams.
Hydropower projects can have both positive and negative environmental effects.
Hydropower is generated in hydroelectric power plants.
Hydropower can be harnessed from natural waterfalls.
Hydropower is considered a sustainable energy source that supports economic and social development.

Geothermal energy.Description: A geothermal power plant harnesses the heat from the Earth's core to generate electricity.
A geothermal heat pump uses the constant temperature of the Earth to provide heating and cooling for buildings.
Geothermal energy is stored in underground reservoirs of hot water and steam.
The geothermal gradient, which is the rate of increase in temperature with depth, affects the availability of geothermal energy.
Geothermal drilling is necessary to access the underground reservoirs of geothermal energy.
Geothermal resource assessment involves evaluating the potential of a geothermal site for energy production.
Geothermal energy can be directly used for heating, such as in geothermal district heating systems.
Geothermal energy can be converted into electricity through geothermal power plants.
Geothermal energy provides a renewable and sustainable source of heating for residential and commercial buildings.
Geothermal energy can be used for cooling purposes, such as in geothermal cooling systems.

Biomass energy.Description: Biomass energy is a form of renewable energy that is derived from organic matter.
The combustion of biomass energy produces carbon dioxide as a byproduct.
Biomass energy can be converted into biofuel for use in transportation and heating.
Biomass energy contributes to waste management by utilizing organic waste materials as a fuel source.
The use of biomass energy supports sustainable development by reducing reliance on fossil fuels.
Biomass energy is used for power generation through the combustion of organic materials.
The use of biomass energy can affect climate change by reducing greenhouse gas emissions compared to fossil fuels.
Biomass energy utilizes renewable resources such as agricultural waste, wood pellets, and energy crops.
Biomass energy is considered carbon neutral because the carbon dioxide released during combustion is offset by the carbon absorbed during the growth of biomass feedstocks.

Tidal power.Description: Tidal power is a type of renewable energy that harnesses the energy from the tides.
Tidal power utilizes tidal barrages, which are large dams built across estuaries or bays to capture the energy of the tides.
Tidal power uses tidal turbines, which are similar to wind turbines but are placed underwater to capture the kinetic energy of the tides.
Tidal power employs tidal lagoons, which are enclosed areas of the sea or estuary that use the rise and fall of the tides to generate electricity.
Tidal power harnesses tidal stream generators, which are underwater turbines that capture the energy from the continuous flow of tidal currents.
Tidal power depends on the tidal range, which is the difference in height between high tide and low tide.
Tidal power can have an impact on marine life, as the installation and operation of tidal power devices may disrupt habitats and affect the behavior of marine organisms.
Tidal power involves the conversion of tidal energy into electricity through various technologies and processes.
Tidal power requires the construction of tidal power plants, which are facilities that house the equipment and infrastructure needed to generate electricity from tidal energy.
Tidal power measures the tidal energy potential of a specific location to determine its suitability for tidal power generation.

Nuclear power.Description: Nuclear power is generated using nuclear reactors.
Nuclear power production results in the generation of nuclear waste.
Nuclear power plants require nuclear fuel for the fission process.
Nuclear power is generated through the process of nuclear fission.
In rare cases, nuclear power plants can experience a nuclear meltdown.
Nuclear power plants emit nuclear radiation as a byproduct.
The use of nuclear power has implications for nuclear disarmament policies.
Nuclear power is generated by nuclear power plants.
Nuclear power plants require strict safety regulations to prevent accidents.

Energy efficiency.Description: Using energy-efficient lighting can improve energy efficiency in buildings.
Proper insulation enhances energy efficiency by reducing heat transfer.
Energy-efficient appliances can significantly affect energy efficiency in households.
Efficient HVAC systems have a positive impact on energy efficiency in buildings.
Integrating renewable energy sources can improve overall energy efficiency.
Energy-efficient building design considers various factors to optimize energy usage.
Smart thermostats utilize advanced technology to optimize energy efficiency in heating and cooling.
Energy audits assess the energy efficiency of buildings and provide recommendations for improvement.
Energy-efficient windows improve insulation and reduce energy loss.
Energy management systems integrate various components to optimize energy efficiency in buildings.

Smart grid.Description: Smart grid integrates renewable energy sources into the electricity grid.
Smart grid connects to the existing electricity grid infrastructure.
Smart grid enables the integration and management of energy storage systems.
Smart grid supports demand response programs to optimize energy consumption.
Smart grid utilizes smart meters for real-time monitoring and control of electricity usage.
Smart grid integrates distributed generation systems, such as solar panels and wind turbines.
Smart grid enables the creation and management of microgrids for localized power generation and distribution.
Smart grid utilizes data analytics to optimize energy distribution and consumption.
Smart grid ensures the security and protection of the electricity grid against cyber threats.
Smart grid optimizes the operation and efficiency of the electricity grid.

Electric vehicles.Description: Electric vehicles use batteries as their primary source of power.
Electric vehicles require charging stations to recharge their batteries.
The limited range of electric vehicles can cause range anxiety among drivers.
Electric vehicles are powered by electric motors instead of internal combustion engines.
Plug-in hybrids are a type of electric vehicle that combines an internal combustion engine with an electric motor and battery.
Electric vehicles utilize regenerative braking technology to convert kinetic energy into electric energy and recharge the battery.
The widespread adoption of electric vehicles relies on the development of a robust electric vehicle charging network.
Electric vehicles commonly employ lithium-ion batteries due to their high energy density and long cycle life.
Electric vehicles are manufactured by companies specializing in the production of electric vehicles.
The use of electric vehicles helps reduce carbon emissions and mitigate climate change.

UN Policies.Description: The UN promotes and protects human rights through various policies and mechanisms.
The UN supports peacekeeping operations to maintain international peace and security.
The UN provides guidance and sets targets for sustainable development through the Sustainable Development Goals.
The UN addresses the issue of climate change through international agreements and policies.
The UN provides assistance and protection to refugees through various policies and programs.
The UN promotes arms control and disarmament to prevent the proliferation of weapons.
The UN advocates for gender equality and women's empowerment through policies and initiatives.
The UN upholds and promotes international law to maintain peace and resolve conflicts.
The UN works towards eradicating poverty through policies and programs aimed at sustainable development.
The UN promotes disarmament and non-proliferation of weapons to enhance global security.

Human Rights.Description: Human rights protect the freedom of speech, allowing individuals to express their opinions without censorship or punishment.
Human rights guarantee the right to education, ensuring that everyone has access to quality education without discrimination.
Human rights ensure the right to privacy, protecting individuals from unwarranted intrusion into their personal lives.
Human rights preserve the right to life, prohibiting arbitrary deprivation of life and protecting individuals from violence or harm.
Human rights promote the right to equality, ensuring that all individuals are treated equally before the law and have equal opportunities.
Human rights guarantee the right to a fair trial, ensuring that individuals are treated justly and have access to legal representation.
Human rights protect the right to health, ensuring access to healthcare services and promoting well-being for all individuals.
Human rights respect the right to freedom of religion, allowing individuals to practice their chosen religion or belief without interference.
Human rights ensure the right to vote, allowing individuals to participate in democratic processes and have a say in governance.
Human rights guarantee the right to housing, ensuring that everyone has access to adequate and affordable housing without discrimination.

Peacekeeping.Description: The United Nations conducts peacekeeping operations worldwide.
Blue Helmets are the peacekeeping forces deployed in conflict zones.
Peacekeeping aims at resolving conflicts and promoting stability.
Peacekeeping missions often provide humanitarian aid to affected populations.
Peacekeeping missions support the implementation and monitoring of ceasefires.
Peacekeeping missions are authorized by the UN Security Council.
Peacekeeping facilitates the negotiation and implementation of peace agreements.
Peacekeeping promotes the disarmament of armed groups in conflict zones.
Peacekeeping missions ensure the protection of civilians in conflict areas.
Peacekeeping contributes to the prevention of conflicts and the maintenance of peace.

Sustainable Development Goals.Description: Promoting the use of renewable energy sources to combat climate change and achieve sustainable development.
Ensuring access to clean water and sanitation for all, which is essential for sustainable development.
Working towards ending hunger, achieving food security, improving nutrition, and promoting sustainable agriculture.
Ensuring inclusive and equitable quality education for all, promoting lifelong learning opportunities, and fostering sustainable development.
Promoting gender equality and empowering women and girls, which is crucial for sustainable development.
Promoting sustained, inclusive, and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment, and decent work for all.
Building resilient infrastructure, promoting inclusive and sustainable industrialization, and fostering innovation for sustainable development.
Reducing inequalities within and among countries, promoting social, economic, and political inclusion for all.
Making cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient, and sustainable.
Taking urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts, as it is one of the greatest challenges to sustainable development.

Climate Change.Description: Greenhouse gases contribute to climate change by trapping heat in the atmosphere.
Deforestation leads to increased carbon dioxide levels, contributing to climate change.
Using renewable energy sources helps reduce greenhouse gas emissions and mitigate climate change.
Climate change causes an increase in global temperatures, leading to various impacts.
Climate change results in increased carbon dioxide absorption by oceans, leading to acidification.
Climate change intensifies extreme weather events such as hurricanes, droughts, and heatwaves.
Climate change causes the melting of ice caps and glaciers, contributing to sea-level rise.
Calculating carbon footprint helps individuals and organizations understand their contribution to climate change.
Mitigation involves reducing greenhouse gas emissions to lessen the impacts of climate change.
Adaptation involves adjusting to the changing climate conditions and minimizing the negative effects.

Refugees.Description: Refugees often live in temporary shelters in refugee camps.
Refugees may initially seek asylum in another country.
Refugees rely on humanitarian aid for basic necessities.
Refugees' ability to seek asylum is influenced by immigration policies.
Refugees may be resettled in a third country through resettlement programs.

Refugees.Relation: are often forced to flee due to
Refugees.Description: Refugees flee their home countries due to armed conflicts and wars.
Refugees face forced displacement from their homes.
Refugees integrate into their host communities.
Refugees have legal rights and protections under international law.
Refugees receive assistance from various non-governmental organizations.

Arms Control.Description: Arms Control aims to regulate the development, possession, and use of nuclear weapons.
Arms Control aims to regulate the development, possession, and use of chemical weapons.
Arms Control aims to regulate the development, possession, and use of biological weapons.
Arms Control aims to regulate the development, possession, and use of missiles.
Arms Control promotes the reduction or elimination of weapons.
Arms Control promotes the prevention of the spread of weapons.
Arms Control involves the process of verifying compliance with arms control agreements.
Arms Control establishes international agreements and treaties to regulate weapons.
Arms Control collaborates with international organizations to implement and enforce arms control measures.
Arms Control aims to prevent an arms race by regulating the development and proliferation of weapons.

Gender Equality.Description: Gender equality aims to ensure equal rights and opportunities for women.
Gender equality challenges societal expectations and norms that limit individuals based on their gender.
Gender equality advocates for equal pay for equal work, regardless of gender.
Gender equality works to eliminate sexual harassment and create safe environments for all genders.
Gender equality supports the rights and inclusion of LGBTQ+ individuals.
Gender equality promotes the feminist movement and its goals of gender equality.
Gender equality advocates for the rights and recognition of transgender individuals.
Gender equality aims to eliminate gender-based violence and create a society free from violence and discrimination.
Gender equality influences the adoption and acceptance of gender-neutral pronouns to promote inclusivity.
Gender equality promotes positive masculinity and challenges harmful stereotypes that affect men.

International Law.Description: The United Nations plays a significant role in the development and enforcement of international law.
The World Trade Organization establishes rules and resolves disputes related to international trade law.
The European Union incorporates international law into its legal framework and contributes to its development.
The International Court of Justice is the principal judicial organ of the United Nations and settles legal disputes between states.
The International Criminal Court investigates and prosecutes individuals for serious international crimes.
The United Nations Security Council has the authority to impose sanctions and authorize the use of force in accordance with international law.
States are expected to comply with international human rights law, which protects the rights and freedoms of individuals.
International environmental law addresses global environmental issues and promotes sustainable development.
International trade law governs the conduct of states and businesses in international trade relations.
International humanitarian law regulates the conduct of armed conflicts and protects victims of war.

Poverty Eradication.Description: Access to quality education is essential for poverty eradication.
Creating employment opportunities helps in poverty eradication.
Access to healthcare services improves the well-being of individuals and contributes to poverty eradication.
Developing infrastructure is crucial for poverty eradication as it enables economic growth and improves living conditions.
Microfinance initiatives provide financial services to the poor, helping them start businesses and escape poverty.
Investing in agriculture and improving farming techniques can increase productivity and reduce poverty.
Promoting gender equality empowers women and reduces poverty by providing equal opportunities.
Access to clean water is essential for poverty eradication as it improves health and sanitation.
Utilizing technology can enhance productivity, create new opportunities, and contribute to poverty eradication.
Good governance and effective institutions are necessary for poverty eradication and sustainable development.

Disarmament.Description: Disarmament involves the reduction or elimination of nuclear weapons.
Disarmament involves the reduction or elimination of chemical weapons.
Disarmament involves the reduction or elimination of biological weapons.
Disarmament involves the reduction or limitation of conventional weapons.
Disarmament involves the reduction or elimination of missiles.
Disarmament promotes the implementation of arms control measures.
Disarmament promotes non-proliferation efforts to prevent the spread of weapons.
Disarmament addresses the regulation and control of arms trade.
Disarmament establishes international treaties for the reduction of weapons.
Disarmament works with the International Atomic Energy Agency to ensure the peaceful use of nuclear energy.

UN Regulations.Description: Develops regulations related to health and safety standards
Establishes regulations for maritime safety and pollution prevention
Sets regulations for international air navigation and aviation safety
Coordinates regulations for global telecommunications networks and services
Promotes regulations for peaceful use of nuclear energy and nuclear safety
Establishes regulations for labor standards and social protection
Administers regulations for international trade and resolving trade disputes
Develops regulations for environmental protection and sustainable development
Provides regulations for international monetary cooperation and financial stability

UN Regulations.Object: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
UN Regulations.Description: Promotes regulations for education, science, culture, and communication

World Health Organization.Description: The World Health Organization is responsible for monitoring and responding to the COVID-19 pandemic.
The World Health Organization has expertise in managing and controlling the Ebola virus disease.
The World Health Organization works towards the global eradication of polio through vaccination campaigns.

World Health Organization.Relation: provides guidance on prevention and treatment of
World Health Organization.Description: The World Health Organization provides guidance on the prevention and treatment of malaria, a mosquito-borne disease.
The World Health Organization promotes vaccination as a crucial medical procedure for preventing infectious diseases.
The World Health Organization collaborates with the healthcare industry to improve global health outcomes.
The World Health Organization responds to pandemics by coordinating international efforts and providing guidance to member states.
The World Health Organization advances the field of public health through research, policy development, and capacity building.
The World Health Organization addresses challenges in global health, including inequalities, access to healthcare, and emerging diseases.

International Maritime Organization.Description: The International Maritime Organization is a specialized agency of the United Nations.
The International Maritime Organization established the International Maritime Law Institute to promote the understanding and knowledge of international maritime law.

International Maritime Organization.Object: International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea
International Maritime Organization.Description: The International Maritime Organization developed the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea to establish minimum safety standards for the construction, equipment, and operation of ships.

International Maritime Organization.Object: International Ship and Port Facility Security Code
International Maritime Organization.Description: The International Maritime Organization implemented the International Ship and Port Facility Security Code to enhance the security of ships and port facilities.

International Maritime Organization.Object: International Convention on Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for Seafarers
International Maritime Organization.Description: The International Maritime Organization adopted the International Convention on Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for Seafarers to establish minimum training, certification, and watchkeeping standards for seafarers.
The International Maritime Organization collaborates with the International Maritime Satellite Organization to provide reliable and efficient communication services to the maritime community.
The International Maritime Organization works closely with the International Maritime Bureau to combat maritime piracy and armed robbery against ships.

International Maritime Organization.Object: International Maritime Solid Bulk Cargoes Code
International Maritime Organization.Description: The International Maritime Organization developed the International Maritime Solid Bulk Cargoes Code to provide guidelines for the safe transportation of solid bulk cargoes by sea.
The International Maritime Organization developed the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code to provide guidelines for the safe transportation of dangerous goods by sea.
The International Maritime Organization awards the International Maritime Prize annually to individuals or organizations that have made significant contributions to the maritime industry.

International Civil Aviation Organizatio.Description: The International Civil Aviation Organization is a specialized agency of the United Nations.
The International Civil Aviation Organization collaborates with the International Air Transport Association to promote safe and efficient air transportation.
The International Civil Aviation Organization works closely with the Federal Aviation Administration to ensure aviation safety and security.
The International Civil Aviation Organization coordinates with the European Aviation Safety Agency to harmonize aviation regulations and standards.
The International Civil Aviation Organization partners with the Airports Council International to enhance airport operations and infrastructure.

International Civil Aviation Organizatio.Object: International Federation of Air Line Pilots' Associations
International Civil Aviation Organizatio.Description: The International Civil Aviation Organization collaborates with the International Federation of Air Line Pilots' Associations to address pilot-related safety issues.
The International Civil Aviation Organization organizes the International Civil Aviation Organization Council, which is its governing body.
The International Civil Aviation Organization convenes the International Civil Aviation Organization Assembly, which is its highest decision-making body.

International Telecommunication Union.Description: The International Telecommunication Union is a specialized agency of the United Nations.
The International Telecommunication Union has a Standardization Sector (ITU-T).
The International Telecommunication Union has a Radiocommunication Sector (ITU-R).
The International Telecommunication Union has a Development Sector (ITU-D).
The International Telecommunication Union has a Study Group (ITU-R SG) within the Radiocommunication Sector.
The International Telecommunication Union has a Study Group (ITU-T SG) within the Standardization Sector.
The International Telecommunication Union has a Study Group (ITU-D SG) within the Development Sector.
The International Telecommunication Union organizes the ITU Plenipotentiary Conference.
The International Telecommunication Union has a Council.

International Atomic Energy Agency.Description: The International Atomic Energy Agency is a specialized agency of the United Nations.
The International Atomic Energy Agency oversees the implementation of the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty.
The International Atomic Energy Agency promotes the peaceful use of nuclear energy.
The International Atomic Energy Agency ensures the safety of nuclear installations and activities.
The International Atomic Energy Agency enhances nuclear security worldwide.
The International Atomic Energy Agency supports the development and application of nuclear technology.
The International Atomic Energy Agency provides guidance on the safe management of nuclear waste.
The International Atomic Energy Agency provides assistance to member states in the safe operation of nuclear power plants.
The International Atomic Energy Agency conducts inspections to verify compliance with safeguards agreements.
The International Atomic Energy Agency supports research and development in the field of nuclear science and technology.

International Labour Organization.Description: The International Labour Organization is a specialized agency of the United Nations.
The International Labour Organization collaborates with the World Health Organization on various health-related issues in the workplace.
The International Labour Organization works closely with the United Nations Development Programme to promote sustainable development and decent work for all.
The International Labour Organization coordinates with the International Monetary Fund to address labor market challenges and promote economic stability.
The International Labour Organization engages in dialogue with the World Trade Organization to ensure that trade policies are compatible with labor standards.
The International Labour Organization partners with the United Nations Children's Fund to combat child labor and protect the rights of children.
The International Labour Organization collaborates with the World Bank on projects related to labor market development and social protection.
The International Labour Organization works closely with the International Atomic Energy Agency to ensure the safety and health of workers in the nuclear industry.

International Labour Organization.Object: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
International Labour Organization.Description: The International Labour Organization collaborates with the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization on initiatives related to education and skills development.
The International Labour Organization works in partnership with the World Intellectual Property Organization to promote intellectual property rights and innovation in the workplace.

World Trade Organization.Description: The United States is a member of the World Trade Organization.
China is a member of the World Trade Organization.
The European Union is a member of the World Trade Organization.
India is a member of the World Trade Organization.
Brazil is a member of the World Trade Organization.
Japan is a member of the World Trade Organization.
Canada is a member of the World Trade Organization.
Mexico is a member of the World Trade Organization.
Australia is a member of the World Trade Organization.
South Korea is a member of the World Trade Organization.

United Nations Environment Programme.Description: The United Nations Environment Programme is a part of the United Nations.
The United Nations Environment Programme focuses on environmental issues.
The United Nations Environment Programme implements the Sustainable Development Goals.
The United Nations Environment Programme addresses the issue of climate change.
The United Nations Environment Programme works towards the conservation of biodiversity.
The United Nations Environment Programme tackles the issue of pollution.
The United Nations Environment Programme promotes the conservation and sustainable use of ecosystems.
The United Nations Environment Programme supports the development and use of renewable energy sources.
The United Nations Environment Programme advocates for the conservation of the environment.

International Monetary Fund.Description: The International Monetary Fund collaborates with the World Bank on various global financial and economic issues.
The International Monetary Fund partners with the United Nations to promote global economic stability and development.
The International Monetary Fund cooperates with the European Union on matters related to financial assistance and economic policies.
The International Monetary Fund consults with the World Trade Organization on trade-related issues that impact global economic stability.
The International Monetary Fund collaborates with the Asian Development Bank to support economic development in the Asia-Pacific region.

International Monetary Fund.Object: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
International Monetary Fund.Description: The International Monetary Fund partners with the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development to promote international economic cooperation and policy coordination.
The International Monetary Fund is a member of the G20, which is a forum for international economic cooperation and decision-making.
The International Monetary Fund collaborates with the United Nations Development Programme to support sustainable development and poverty reduction efforts.
The International Monetary Fund cooperates with the Bank for International Settlements on matters related to global financial stability and regulation.
The International Monetary Fund collaborates with the African Development Bank to support economic development in Africa.

United Nations Educational, Scientific a.Description: UNESCO is the abbreviation for United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
UNESCO manages the World Heritage Sites program
UNESCO supports the Intangible Cultural Heritage program
UNESCO promotes the Education for All program
UNESCO appoints Goodwill Ambassadors to promote its mission
UNESCO designates a city as the World Book Capital each year
UNESCO coordinates the Creative Cities Network
UNESCO supports the Global Geoparks program
UNESCO preserves the Memory of the World program
UNESCO oversees the World Heritage Committee
